name: forgivably
content:
Add to word list

in a way that you can forgive because you understand it: Sometimes - and perhaps forgivably - my grandmother tries to do too much. The movie was clearly filmed on a low budget; less forgivably, it is dull.
More examplesFewer examplesIn a life so varied and full, fact can forgivably merge into fiction at times.If you believed everything you saw in advertising, you could forgivably conclude that all women are young and thin.This is an exciting, if forgivably predictable, ending, leaving the way open for a second series.
